channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14345] Consolidate printUsage in IntegrationTestLoadAndVerify
item.description:
Investigating the use of itlav is a little screwy. Subclasses are not overriding the printUsage() methods correctly, so you have to pass --help to get some info and no arguments to get the rest.

[hbase@ndimiduk-112rc2-7 ~]$ hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.test.IntegrationTestLoadAndVerify --help

usage: bin/hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.test.IntegrationTestLoadAndVerify <options>

Options:

 -h,--help                 Show usage

 -m,--monkey <arg>         Which chaos monkey to run

 -monkeyProps <arg>        The properties file for specifying chaos monkey properties.

 -ncc,--noClusterCleanUp   Don't clean up the cluster at the end

[hbase@ndimiduk-112rc2-7 ~]$ hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.test.IntegrationTestLoadAndVerify

IntegrationTestLoadAndVerify [-Doptions] <load|verify|loadAndVerify>

  Loads a table with row dependencies and verifies the dependency chains

Options

  -Dloadmapper.table=<name>        Table to write/verify (default autogen)

  -Dloadmapper.backrefs=<n>        Number of backreferences per row (default 50)

  -Dloadmapper.num_to_write=<n>    Number of rows per mapper (default 100,000 per mapper)

  -Dloadmapper.deleteAfter=<bool>  Delete after a successful verify (default true)

  -Dloadmapper.numPresplits=<n>    Number of presplit regions to start with (default 40)

  -Dloadmapper.map.tasks=<n>       Number of map tasks for load (default 200)

  -Dverify.reduce.tasks=<n>        Number of reduce tasks for verify (default 35)

  -Dverify.scannercaching=<n>      Number hbase scanner caching rows to read (default 50)

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: This is nothing to do with overriding printUsage() method. I was checking couple of other classes of same package and I think the problem with the way this class written. This class should have overridden addOptions() method and get the corresponding value in processOptions() but this class is not doing that. I am trying to figure out how to pass optional loadmapper.table parameter with out doing major change.

Hi~

i fixed it
can anyone give me permissions to attach screenshot and patch?

attached.

thanks

if there are problems, or it still needs to improve, please point it out and let me know.
Thank you~
-D args are used up by GenericOptionsParser and then removed from args list (see ToolRunner#run()). So they never make to processOptions(). A simple fix what Reid has posted should suffice.

+1
lets wait for a day or two to see if anyone things differently.

Is this a typo? 


+    System.err.println("Doptions");

We should not call System.exit() if it is not main() method. Tool instances can be invoked programmatically as well in which case you don't want to call exit. 


+      System.exit(EXIT_FAILURE);

Yes, change it to "Options"

I commented out the "System.exit(EXIT_FAILURE);" and attached a new screenshot.
As it shows, it exits anyway and the exception trace stack will be printed which i thought it was ugly and useless to users. That's why "System.exit(EXIT_FAILURE);" was explicitly added in patch.

Just want to make sure if "System.exit(EXIT_FAILURE);" should be discarded. And i will re-attach a new patch fixed as suggestions, after your confirmation.

Thanks

Reid Chan, Enis is right that we can't use System.exit here. The reason is as he mentioned

We should not call System.exit() if it is not main() method. Tool instances can be invoked programmatically as well in which case you don't want to call exit.

Basically, what if a user writes own test using this test, exit will forcefully bring down his/her program. That's why, the right way in general is to thrown exceptions from functions which can be invoked programmatically by user, so that they can handle failure scenarios as they deem fit.
Since main() function is something invoked from command line and isn't supposed to be called from a user function, it's fine to use exits there.

In this case specifically, we can thrown runtime exception with appropriate message instead of arraybound exception. Similar to throw new RuntimeException("Incorrect Number of args."); in processOptions() function.

Fixed
1. "Doptions" → "Options"
2. Remove System.exit
3. throw RuntimeException same as the original

004.patch has Incompatible changes, but 002.patch passed.
there is no great difference between two patches

Following hadoop check commands passed locally (osx, java 1.7.0_79_
mvn clean install -DskipTests -DHBasePatchProcess -Dhadoop-two.version=2.6.2 > temp2 2>&1
mvn clean install -DskipTests -DHBasePatchProcess -Dhadoop-two.version=2.7.1 > temp2 2>&1

so +1

Reid Chan, the patch you have uploaded is raw patch and doesn't contain information like author, patch description,etc.
Please use dev-support/submit-patch.py or format-patch.sh.
submit-patch.py will create and upload the patch to jira. Make sure to read help. It takes 10-15 min to setup but will makes things very easy for future.
Thanks Appy
QA doesn't response.

Reid Chan, the commit message should follow this guideline. http://hbase.apache.org/book.html#_commit_message_format
Basically,
HBASE-XXXXX <describe what the patch does> (<Author>)

You can see the examples here: https://github.com/apache/hbase/commits/master
Also, you might want to configure git settings to use your email id associated with github in the "From: Reid ...." field so that your contribution appears in the github account.
Thanks for your patience Appy
